text: when i first stepped foot on the hbs
campus i knew that i wanted to pursue my
career passion
which is focused in startups and
entrepreneurship
before i came to hbs i had worked for a
very large company
and while i learned a lot there i
realized that i wanted to work in a much
smaller
environment
contrary to popular belief a lot of hbs
students are very excited to take risks
i have plenty of friends who are
starting their own companies but there
are also a ton of friends of mine who
are really interested in joining smaller
startups
the clubs that i was involved with the
most were the entrepreneurship club
and the startup tribe as well as the
tech media club and these clubs were all
focused on the space that i was most
interested in which were technology
startups
in the tech media club we're always
looking to learn and understand the
newest technologies
all of us read techcrunch and the latest
publications to really get up to speed
and
understand what's really hot in the
startup space and it's great to also
have the community to talk to each other
about ideas and what we're learning
and interesting companies that we may
want to work for after school
through these clubs i was able to
connect with founders of startups so i'd
flown out to
seattle and san francisco and had the
really unique opportunity of visiting
the various startups and learning about
their company clubs like the tech media
club are a great place for
companies that are interested in hiring
mbas to come find great talent these
people are all very interested in
technology
the emerging trends in the space and are
all looking to make a big impact
in the industry
a really valuable resource for me has
been the rock center for
entrepreneurship
once i decided that i wanted to spend my
summer interning at a startup
the rock center was fantastic in
offering a fellowship that
was able to match what i was getting
from the startup
and so it helped me live much more
comfortably while still being able to
pursue
a career interest of mine that you know
i was very excited about
once graduating from hbs i'll be joining
path it is a startup in the social
networking space i had the awesome
opportunity of interning there last
summer when they were
roughly 20 people there are close to now
30 people and i've had
an amazing chance to see the company
grow and now be able to join after
school
you
